alert.note: Alert for Benton; Cedar; Henry; Iowa; Jefferson; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Louisa; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 9:02PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Henry, northwestern Louisa, Keokuk, western Cedar, Johnson, southeastern Benton, Washington, southwestern Jones, Jefferson, southern Linn and Iowa Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 902 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Palo to 7 miles northwest of Keswick to 7 miles southwest of Oskaloosa. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Iowa City, Fairfield, Washington, Marengo, West Branch, Sigourney, Mechanicsville, Marion, Coralville, North Liberty, Hiawatha, Mount Vernon, Robins, Williamsburg, Kalona, Lisbon, Fairfax, Solon and Tiffin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 206 and 264. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for east central Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Cedar; Henry; Iowa; Jefferson; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Louisa; Washington
